verses.verse: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ <S%H5329><s%> lam-natz-Tze-acho the chief Musician; לִידִיתוּן[T[li-di-tun כלִֽידוּת֗וּן <S%H3038><s%> li-du-Tun, Jeduthun קמִזְמ֥וֹר <S%H4210><s%> miz-Mor A Psalm לְדָוִֽד׃ <S%H1732><s%> le-da-Vid. of David אָמַ֗רְתִּי <S%H559><s%> 'a-Mar-ti, I said אֶֽשְׁמְרָ֣ה <S%H8104><s%> 'esh-me-Rah I will take heed דְרָכַי֮ <S%H1870><s%> de-ra-Chai to my ways מֵחֲט֪וֹא <S%H2398><s%> me-cha-To that I sin בִלְשׁ֫וֹנִ֥י <S%H3956><s%> vil-Sho-Ni not with my tongue אֶשְׁמְרָ֥ה <S%H8104><s%> 'esh-me-Rah I will keep לְפִ֥י <S%H6310><s%> le-Fi my mouth מַחְס֑וֹם <S%H4269><s%> mach-Som; with a bridle בְּעֹ֖ד <S%H5704><s%> be-'Od against רָשָׁ֣ע <S%H7563><s%> ra-Sha' while the wicked לְנֶגְדִּֽי׃ <S%H5048><s%> le-neg-Di. my presence

נֶאֱלַ֣מְתִּי <S%H481><s%> ne-'e-Lam-ti I was dumb ד֭וּמִיָּה <S%H1747><s%> Du-mi-yah with silence הֶחֱשֵׁ֣יתִי <S%H2814><s%> he-che-Shei-ti I held my peace מִטּ֑וֹב <S%H2896><s%> mit-Tov; [even] from good וּכְאֵבִ֥י <S%H3511><s%> u-che-'e-Vi and my sorrow נֶעְכָּֽר׃ <S%H5916><s%> ne'-Kar. was stirred

חַם־ <S%H2552><s%> cham- was hot לִבִּ֨י׀ <S%H3820><s%> lib-Bi My heart בְּקִרְבִּ֗י <S%H7130><s%> be-kir-Bi, within בַּהֲגִיגִ֥י <S%H1901><s%> ba-ha-gi-Gi me while I was musing תִבְעַר־ <S%H1197><s%> tiv-'ar- burned אֵ֑שׁ <S%H784><s%> 'Esh; the fire דִּ֝בַּ֗רְתִּי <S%H1696><s%> dib-Bar-ti, spake בִּלְשֽׁוֹנִי׃ <S%H3956><s%> bil-Sho-ni. I with my tongue

הוֹדִ֘יעֵ֤נִי <S%H3045><s%> ho-Di-'E-ni make me to know יְהוָ֨ה׀ <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh LORD קִצִּ֗י <S%H7093><s%> kitz-Tzi, mine end וּמִדַּ֣ת <S%H4060><s%> u-mid-Dat and the measure יָמַ֣י <S%H3117><s%> ya-Mai of my days מַה־ <S%H4100><s%> mah- and what הִ֑יא <S%H1931><s%> Hi; me אֵ֝דְעָ֗ה <S%H3045><s%> 'e-de-'Ah, what it [is that] I may know מֶה־ <S%H4100><s%> meh- how חָדֵ֥ל <S%H2310><s%> cha-Del how frail אָֽנִי׃ <S%H589><s%> 'A-ni. I

הִנֵּ֤ה <S%H2009><s%> hin-Neh Behold טְפָח֨וֹת׀ <S%H2947><s%> te-fa-Chot [as] an handbreadth נָ֘תַ֤תָּה <S%H5414><s%> na-Tat-tah Behold thou hast made יָמַ֗י <S%H3117><s%> ya-Mai, my days וְחֶלְדִּ֣י <S%H2465><s%> ve-chel-Di and mine age כְאַ֣יִן <S%H369><s%> che-'A-yin nothing נֶגְדֶּ֑ךָ <S%H5048><s%> neg-De-cha; your sight אַ֥ךְ <S%H389><s%> 'ach Surely כָּֽל־ <S%H3605><s%> kal- [is] as nothing before thee verily every הֶ֥בֶל <S%H1892><s%> He-vel vanity כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- [is] altogether אָ֝דָ֗ם <S%H120><s%> 'a-Dam, man נִצָּ֥ב <S%H5324><s%> nitz-Tzav at his best state סֶֽלָה׃ <S%H5542><s%> Se-lah. Selah

אַךְ־ <S%H389><s%> 'ach- Surely בְּצֶ֤לֶם׀ <S%H6754><s%> be-Tze-lem in a vain shew יִֽתְהַלֶּךְ־ <S%H1980><s%> yit-hal-lech- walketh אִ֗ישׁ <S%H376><s%> 'Ish, Surely every man אַךְ־ <S%H389><s%> 'ach- Surely הֶ֥בֶל <S%H1892><s%> He-vel in vain יֶהֱמָי֑וּן <S%H1993><s%> ye-he-ma-Yun; surely they are disquieted יִ֝צְבֹּ֗ר <S%H6651><s%> yitz-Bor, he heapeth up וְֽלֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> ve-lo- and does not יֵדַ֥ע <S%H3045><s%> ye-Da' [riches] and knoweth מִי־ <S%H4310><s%> mi- who אֹסְפָֽם׃ <S%H622><s%> 'o-se-Fam. not who shall gather

וְעַתָּ֣ה <S%H6258><s%> ve-'at-Tah and now מַה־ <S%H4100><s%> mah- what קִּוִּ֣יתִי <S%H6960><s%> kiv-Vi-ti what wait אֲדֹנָ֑י <S%H136><s%> 'a-do-Nai; And now Lord תּ֝וֹחַלְתִּ֗י <S%H8431><s%> to-chal-Ti, I for;my hope לְךָ֣ le-Cha הִֽיא׃ <S%H1931><s%> Hi. he

מִכָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> mik-kol all פְּשָׁעַ֥י <S%H6588><s%> pe-sha-'Ai me from all my transgressions הַצִּילֵ֑נִי <S%H5337><s%> hatz-tzi-Le-ni; Deliver חֶרְפַּ֥ת <S%H2781><s%> cher-Pat me not the reproach נָ֝בָ֗ל <S%H5036><s%> na-Val, of the foolish אַל־ <S%H408><s%> 'al- nay תְּשִׂימֵֽנִי׃ <S%H7760><s%> te-si-Me-ni. make

נֶ֭אֱלַמְתִּי <S%H481><s%> Ne-'e-lam-ti I was dumb לֹ֣א <S%H3808><s%> lo not אֶפְתַּח־ <S%H6605><s%> 'ef-tach- I opened פִּ֑י <S%H6310><s%> Pi; not my mouth כִּ֖י <S%H3588><s%> ki Because אַתָּ֣ה <S%H859><s%> 'at-Tah who עָשִֽׂיתָ׃ <S%H6213><s%> 'a-Si-ta. because thou didst

הָסֵ֣ר <S%H5493><s%> ha-Ser away מֵעָלַ֣י <S%H5921><s%> me-'a-Lai and נִגְעֶ֑ךָ <S%H5061><s%> nig-'E-cha; thy stroke מִתִּגְרַ֥ת <S%H8409><s%> mit-tig-Rat by the blow יָ֝דְךָ֗ <S%H3027><s%> ya-de-cha, of thine hand אֲנִ֣י <S%H589><s%> 'a-Ni I am כָלִֽיתִי׃ <S%H3615><s%> cha-Li-ti. from me I am consumed

בְּֽתוֹכָ֘ח֤וֹת <S%H8433><s%> be-to-Cha-Chot When thou with rebukes עַל־ <S%H5921><s%> 'al- for עָוֹ֨ן׀ <S%H5771><s%> 'a-Von for iniquity יִסַּ֬רְתָּ <S%H3256><s%> yis-Sar-ta dost correct אִ֗ישׁ <S%H376><s%> 'Ish, man וַתֶּ֣מֶס <S%H4529><s%> vat-Te-mes to consume away כָּעָ֣שׁ <S%H6211><s%> ka-'Ash like a moth חֲמוּד֑וֹ <S%H2530><s%> cha-mu-Do; thou makest his beauty אַ֤ךְ <S%H389><s%> 'ach Surely הֶ֖בֶל <S%H1892><s%> He-vel [is] vanity כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- every אָדָ֣ם <S%H120><s%> 'a-Dam surely every man סֶֽלָה׃ <S%H5542><s%> Se-lah. Selah

שִֽׁמְעָ֥ה־ <S%H8085><s%> shim-'Ah- Hear תְפִלָּתִ֨י׀ <S%H8605><s%> te-fil-la-Ti my prayer יְהוָ֡ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh O LORD וְשַׁוְעָתִ֨י׀ <S%H7775><s%> ve-shav-'a-Ti unto my cry הַאֲזִינָה֮ <S%H238><s%> ha-'a-zi-Nah and give ear אֶֽל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- at דִּמְעָתִ֗י <S%H1832><s%> dim-'a-Ti, at my tears אַֽל־ <S%H408><s%> 'al- not תֶּ֫חֱרַ֥שׁ <S%H2790><s%> te-che-Rash hold not thy peace כִּ֤י <S%H3588><s%> ki I am a גֵ֣ר <S%H1616><s%> ger for I [am] a stranger אָנֹכִ֣י <S%H595><s%> 'a-no-Chi I עִמָּ֑ךְ <S%H5973><s%> 'im-Mach; You תּ֝וֹשָׁ֗ב <S%H8453><s%> to-Shav, with thee [and] a sojourner כְּכָל־ <S%H3605><s%> ke-chol- all אֲבוֹתָֽי׃ <S%H1><s%> a-vo-Tai. as all my fathers

הָשַׁ֣ע <S%H8159><s%> ha-Sha' O spare מִמֶּ֣נִּי <S%H4480><s%> mi-Men-ni at וְאַבְלִ֑יגָה <S%H1082><s%> ve-'av-Li-gah; me that I may recover strength בְּטֶ֖רֶם <S%H2962><s%> be-Te-rem Before אֵלֵ֣ךְ <S%H1980><s%> 'e-Lech depart וְאֵינֶֽנִּי׃ <S%H369><s%> ve-'ei-Nen-ni. no
